  <<<Analysis>>>
The code first takes an integer input n from the user.
It then initializes an empty list l.
The code enters a while loop that continues until n is 0.
Inside the loop, the code checks if n is divisible by 3.
If it is, it appends a "0" to the front of l and divides n by 3.
If n is not divisible by 3 but is 1 more than a multiple of 3, it appends a "+" to the front of l and subtracts 1 from n, then divides n by 3.
If n is not divisible by 3 and is 1 less than a multiple of 3, it appends a "-" to the front of l and adds 1 to n, then divides n by 3.
After the loop finishes, the code joins the elements of l into a string and prints it.
